info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 12:00AM AKST until November 17 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
...KLONDIKE HIGHWAY SNOW MONDAY INTO TUESDAY MORNING...
.Another cold front will move across the Panhandle, bringing more extensive snow back to northern areas on Monday. The current forecast has confidence of 3 to 5 inches of snow accumulation with the greatest amounts at the highest elevations along the Klondike Highway near White Pass for a 12-hour period starting Monday morning and lasting through Monday evening.
Light snow will begin again very early Monday morning. The heaviest rates will come in sometime Monday afternoon until 6pm, with potential of a few hours of 0.5+ inch per hour rates. After the front passes, the snowfall rates will precipitously decrease with persistent light snow into Tuesday morning.
* WHAT...Snow expected. Snow accumulations ranging from 3 to 5 inches.
* WHERE...Klondike Highway North of MP 6.
* WHEN...From 6 AM to 6 PM AKST Monday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected Monday afternoon with snowfall rates of up to 0.5+ inches per hour.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM AKST MONDAY
